service.name: Amazon CloudWatch
service.documentation:
-- | Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring service for AWS cloud resources and the
-- applications you run on AWS. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to collect and
-- track metrics, collect and monitor log files, and set alarms. Amazon
-- CloudWatch can monitor AWS resources such as Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon
-- DynamoDB tables, and Amazon RDS DB instances, as well as custom metrics
-- generated by your applications and services, and any log files your
-- applications generate. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to gain system-wide
-- visibility into resource utilization, application performance, and
-- operational health. You can use these insights to react and keep your
-- application running smoothly.

cabal.name: Amazon CloudWatch
cabal.description:
Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring service for AWS cloud resources and the
applications you run on AWS. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to collect and
track metrics, collect and monitor log files, and set alarms. Amazon
CloudWatch can monitor AWS resources such as Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon
DynamoDB tables, and Amazon RDS DB instances, as well as custom metrics
generated by your applications and services, and any log files your
applications generate. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to gain system-wide
visibility into resource utilization, application performance, and
operational health. You can use these insights to react and keep your
application running smoothly.

required.name: _ssSampleCount
required.documentation: -- | The number of samples used for the statistic set.

required.name: _ssSum
required.documentation: -- | The sum of values for the sample set.

required.name: _ssMinimum
required.documentation: -- | The minimum value of the sample set.

required.name: _ssMaximum
required.documentation: -- | The maximum value of the sample set.

fields.name: _ssMaximum
fields.documentation: -- | The maximum value of the sample set.

fields.name: _ssMinimum
fields.documentation: -- | The minimum value of the sample set.

fields.name: _ssSampleCount
fields.documentation: -- | The number of samples used for the statistic set.

fields.name: _ssSum
fields.documentation: -- | The sum of values for the sample set.

optional.name: _maAlarmName
optional.documentation: -- | The name of the alarm.

optional.name: _maAlarmArn
optional.documentation: -- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.

optional.name: _maAlarmDescription
optional.documentation: -- | The description for the alarm.

optional.name: _maAlarmConfigurationUpdatedTimestamp
optional.documentation:
-- | The time stamp of the last update to the alarm configuration. Amazon
-- CloudWatch uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when returning time stamps,
-- which do not accommodate seasonal adjustments such as daylight savings time.
-- For more information, see <http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/cloudwatch_concepts.html#about_timestamp Time stamps> in the /Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide/
-- .

optional.name: _maActionsEnabled
optional.documentation:
-- | Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the
-- alarm's state.

optional.name: _maOKActions
optional.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'OK' state
-- from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number
-- (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an Amazon SNS
-- topic and triggering an Auto Scaling policy.

optional.name: _maAlarmActions
optional.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'ALARM'
-- state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource
-- Number (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an
-- Amazon SNS topic and triggering an Auto Scaling policy.

optional.name: _maInsufficientDataActions
optional.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'INSUFFICIENT_DATA' state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource
-- Number (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an
-- Amazon SNS topic or triggering an Auto Scaling policy.
--
-- The current WSDL lists this attribute as 'UnknownActions'.

optional.name: _maStateValue
optional.documentation: -- | The state value for the alarm.

optional.name: _maStateReason
optional.documentation: -- | A human-readable explanation for the alarm's state.

optional.name: _maStateReasonData
optional.documentation: -- | An explanation for the alarm's state in machine-readable JSON format

optional.name: _maStateUpdatedTimestamp
optional.documentation:
-- | The time stamp of the last update to the alarm's state. Amazon CloudWatch
-- uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when returning time stamps, which do
-- not accommodate seasonal adjustments such as daylight savings time. For more
-- information, see <http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/cloudwatch_concepts.html#about_timestamp Time stamps> in the /Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide/.

optional.name: _maMetricName
optional.documentation: -- | The name of the alarm's metric.

optional.name: _maNamespace
optional.documentation: -- | The namespace of alarm's associated metric.

optional.name: _maStatistic
optional.documentation: -- | The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric.

optional.name: _maDimensions
optional.documentation: -- | The list of dimensions associated with the alarm's associated metric.

optional.name: _maPeriod
optional.documentation: -- | The period in seconds over which the statistic is applied.

optional.name: _maUnit
optional.documentation: -- | The unit of the alarm's associated metric.

optional.name: _maEvaluationPeriods
optional.documentation:
-- | The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
-- threshold.

optional.name: _maThreshold
optional.documentation: -- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

optional.name: _maComparisonOperator
optional.documentation: -- | The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified 'Statistic' and 'Threshold'. The specified 'Statistic' value is used as the first operand.

required.name: _mdMetricName
required.documentation: -- | The name of the metric.

optional.name: _mdDimensions
optional.documentation:
-- | A list of dimensions associated with the metric. Note, when using the
-- Dimensions value in a query, you need to append .member.N to it (e.g.,
-- Dimensions.member.N).

optional.name: _mdTimestamp
optional.documentation:
-- | The time stamp used for the metric. If not specified, the default value is
-- set to the time the metric data was received. Amazon CloudWatch uses
-- Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when returning time stamps, which do not
-- accommodate seasonal adjustments such as daylight savings time. For more
-- information, see <http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/cloudwatch_concepts.html#about_timestamp Time stamps> in the /Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide/.

optional.name: _mdValue
optional.documentation:
-- | The value for the metric.
--
-- Although the 'Value' parameter accepts numbers of type 'Double', Amazon
-- CloudWatch truncates values with very large exponents. Values with base-10
-- exponents greater than 126 (1 x 10^126) are truncated. Likewise, values with
-- base-10 exponents less than -130 (1 x 10^-130) are also truncated.

optional.name: _mdStatisticValues
optional.documentation: -- | A set of statistical values describing the metric.

optional.name: _mdUnit
optional.documentation: -- | The unit of the metric.

fields.name: _mdDimensions
fields.documentation:

-- Dimensions.member.N).

operations.documentation:

-- deleted.

operations.name: DescribeAlarmHistory
operations.documentation:
-- | Retrieves history for the specified alarm. Filter alarms by date range or
-- item type. If an alarm name is not specified, Amazon CloudWatch returns
-- histories for all of the owner's alarms.

optional.name: _dahAlarmName
optional.documentation: -- | The name of the alarm.

optional.name: _dahHistoryItemType
optional.documentation: -- | The type of alarm histories to retrieve.

optional.name: _dahStartDate
optional.documentation: -- | The starting date to retrieve alarm history.

optional.name: _dahEndDate
optional.documentation: -- | The ending date to retrieve alarm history.

optional.name: _dahMaxRecords
optional.documentation: -- | The maximum number of alarm history records to retrieve.

optional.name: _dahNextToken
optional.documentation:
-- | The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data
-- available.

fields.name: _dahNextToken

optional.documentation: -- | A list of information for the specified alarms.

operations.name: DescribeAlarms
operations.documentation:
-- | Retrieves alarms with the specified names. If no name is specified, all
-- alarms for the user are returned. Alarms can be retrieved by using only a
-- prefix for the alarm name, the alarm state, or a prefix for any action.

optional.name: _daAlarmNames
optional.documentation: -- | A list of alarm names to retrieve information for.

optional.name: _daAlarmNamePrefix
optional.documentation:
-- | The alarm name prefix. 'AlarmNames' cannot be specified if this parameter is
-- specified.

optional.name: _daStateValue
optional.documentation: -- | The state value to be used in matching alarms.

optional.name: _daActionPrefix
optional.documentation: -- | The action name prefix.

optional.name: _daMaxRecords
optional.documentation: -- | The maximum number of alarm descriptions to retrieve.

optional.name: _daNextToken
optional.documentation:
-- | The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data
-- available.

fields.name: _daActionPrefix
fields.documentation: -- | The action name prefix.

fields.name: _daAlarmNamePrefix
fields.documentation:
-- | The alarm name prefix. 'AlarmNames' cannot be specified if this parameter is
-- specified.

fields.documentation: -- | A list of alarm names to retrieve information for.

fields.name: _daMaxRecords
fields.documentation: -- | The maximum number of alarm descriptions to retrieve.

fields.name: _daNextToken
fields.documentation:
-- | The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data
-- available.

fields.documentation: -- | The state value to be used in matching alarms.

operations.name: DisableAlarmActions
operations.documentation:
-- | Disables actions for the specified alarms. When an alarm's actions are
-- disabled the alarm's state may change, but none of the alarm's actions will
-- execute.

field.name: _daaAlarmNames
field.documentation: -- | The names of the alarms to disable actions for.

optional.name: _daaAlarmNames
optional.documentation: -- | The names of the alarms to disable actions for.

operations.name: GetMetricStatistics
operations.documentation:
-- | Gets statistics for the specified metric.
--
-- The maximum number of data points returned from a single 'GetMetricStatistics'
-- request is 1,440, wereas the maximum number of data points that can be
-- queried is 50,850. If you make a request that generates more than 1,440 data
-- points, Amazon CloudWatch returns an error. In such a case, you can alter the
-- request by narrowing the specified time range or increasing the specified
-- period. Alternatively, you can make multiple requests across adjacent time
-- ranges.
--
-- Amazon CloudWatch aggregates data points based on the length of the 'period'
-- that you specify. For example, if you request statistics with a one-minute
-- granularity, Amazon CloudWatch aggregates data points with time stamps that
-- fall within the same one-minute period. In such a case, the data points
-- queried can greatly outnumber the data points returned.
--
-- The following examples show various statistics allowed by the data point
-- query maximum of 50,850 when you call 'GetMetricStatistics' on Amazon EC2
-- instances with detailed (one-minute) monitoring enabled:
--
-- Statistics for up to 400 instances for a span of one hour Statistics for up
-- to 35 instances over a span of 24 hours Statistics for up to 2 instances over
-- a span of 2 weeks   For information about the namespace, metric names, and
-- dimensions that other Amazon Web Services products use to send metrics to
-- Cloudwatch, go to <http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/CW_Support_For_AWS.html Amazon CloudWatch Metrics, Namespaces, and DimensionsReference> in the /Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide/.

required.name: _gmsNamespace
required.documentation: -- | The namespace of the metric, with or without spaces.

required.name: _gmsMetricName
required.documentation: -- | The name of the metric, with or without spaces.

required.name: _gmsStartTime
required.documentation:
-- | The time stamp to use for determining the first datapoint to return. The
-- value specified is inclusive; results include datapoints with the time stamp
-- specified.

required.name: _gmsEndTime
required.documentation:
-- | The time stamp to use for determining the last datapoint to return. The
-- value specified is exclusive; results will include datapoints up to the time
-- stamp specified.

required.name: _gmsPeriod
required.documentation:
-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the returned datapoints. 'Period' must be at
-- least 60 seconds and must be a multiple of 60. The default value is 60.

required.name: _gmsStatistics
required.documentation:
-- | The metric statistics to return. For information about specific statistics
-- returned by GetMetricStatistics, go to <http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/index.html?CHAP_TerminologyandKeyConcepts.html#Statistic Statistics> in the /Amazon CloudWatchDeveloper Guide/.
--
-- Valid Values: 'Average | Sum | SampleCount | Maximum | Minimum'

optional.name: _gmsDimensions
optional.documentation: -- | A list of dimensions describing qualities of the metric.

optional.name: _gmsUnit
optional.documentation: -- | The unit for the metric.

fields.name: _gmsDimensions
fields.documentation: -- | A list of dimensions describing qualities of the metric.

fields.name: _gmsEndTime

-- value specified is exclusive; results will include datapoints up to the time
-- stamp specified.

-- | The time stamp to use for determining the first datapoint to return. The
-- value specified is inclusive; results include datapoints with the time stamp
-- specified.

fields.name: _gmsStatistics

--
-- Valid Values: 'Average | Sum | SampleCount | Maximum | Minimum'

fields.name: _gmsUnit
fields.documentation: -- | The unit for the metric.

optional.documentation: -- | A list of metrics used to generate statistics for an AWS account.

optional.name: _lmrNextToken
optional.documentation: -- | A string that marks the start of the next batch of returned results.

operations.name: ListMetrics
operations.documentation:
-- | Returns a list of valid metrics stored for the AWS account owner. Returned
-- metrics can be used with 'GetMetricStatistics' to obtain statistical data for a
-- given metric.

optional.name: _lmNamespace
optional.documentation: -- | The namespace to filter against.

optional.name: _lmMetricName
optional.documentation: -- | The name of the metric to filter against.

optional.name: _lmDimensions
optional.documentation: -- | A list of dimensions to filter against.

optional.name: _lmNextToken
optional.documentation:
-- | The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data
-- available.

fields.name: _lmDimensions
fields.documentation: -- | A list of dimensions to filter against.

fields.name: _lmMetricName
fields.documentation: -- | The name of the metric to filter against.

fields.name: _lmNamespace
fields.documentation: -- | The namespace to filter against.

fields.name: _lmNextToken
fields.documentation:
-- | The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data
-- available.

operations.name: PutMetricAlarm
operations.documentation:
-- | Creates or updates an alarm and associates it with the specified Amazon
-- CloudWatch metric. Optionally, this operation can associate one or more
-- Amazon Simple Notification Service resources with the alarm.
--
-- When this operation creates an alarm, the alarm state is immediately set to 'INSUFFICIENT_DATA'. The alarm is evaluated and its 'StateValue' is set
-- appropriately. Any actions associated with the 'StateValue' is then executed.

required.name: _pmaAlarmName
required.documentation:
-- | The descriptive name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the
-- user's AWS account

required.name: _pmaMetricName
required.documentation: -- | The name for the alarm's associated metric.

required.name: _pmaNamespace
required.documentation: -- | The namespace for the alarm's associated metric.

required.name: _pmaStatistic
required.documentation: -- | The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric.

required.name: _pmaPeriod
required.documentation: -- | The period in seconds over which the specified statistic is applied.

required.name: _pmaEvaluationPeriods
required.documentation:
-- | The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
-- threshold.

required.name: _pmaThreshold
required.documentation: -- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

required.name: _pmaComparisonOperator
required.documentation: -- | The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified 'Statistic' and 'Threshold'. The specified 'Statistic' value is used as the first operand.

optional.name: _pmaAlarmDescription
optional.documentation: -- | The description for the alarm.

optional.name: _pmaActionsEnabled
optional.documentation:
-- | Indicates whether or not actions should be executed during any changes to
-- the alarm's state.

optional.name: _pmaOKActions
optional.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'OK' state
-- from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number
-- (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS
-- topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

optional.name: _pmaAlarmActions
optional.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'ALARM'
-- state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource
-- Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon
-- SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

optional.name: _pmaInsufficientDataActions
optional.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'INSUFFICIENT_DATA' state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource
-- Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon
-- SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

optional.name: _pmaDimensions
optional.documentation: -- | The dimensions for the alarm's associated metric.

optional.name: _pmaUnit
optional.documentation: -- | The unit for the alarm's associated metric.

fields.name: _pmaActionsEnabled
fields.documentation:
-- | Indicates whether or not actions should be executed during any changes to
-- the alarm's state.

fields.name: _pmaAlarmActions
fields.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'ALARM'
-- state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource
-- Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon
-- SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

fields.name: _pmaAlarmDescription
fields.documentation: -- | The description for the alarm.

fields.documentation:
-- | The descriptive name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the
-- user's AWS account

fields.name: _pmaComparisonOperator
fields.documentation: -- | The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified 'Statistic' and 'Threshold'. The specified 'Statistic' value is used as the first operand.

fields.name: _pmaDimensions
fields.documentation: -- | The dimensions for the alarm's associated metric.

fields.name: _pmaEvaluationPeriods
fields.documentation:
-- | The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
-- threshold.

fields.name: _pmaInsufficientDataActions
fields.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'INSUFFICIENT_DATA' state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource
-- Number (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon
-- SNS topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

fields.name: _pmaMetricName
fields.documentation: -- | The name for the alarm's associated metric.

fields.name: _pmaNamespace
fields.documentation: -- | The namespace for the alarm's associated metric.

fields.name: _pmaOKActions
fields.documentation:
-- | The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an 'OK' state
-- from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number
-- (ARN). Currently the only action supported is publishing to an Amazon SNS
-- topic or an Amazon Auto Scaling policy.

fields.name: _pmaPeriod
fields.documentation: -- | The period in seconds over which the specified statistic is applied.

fields.name: _pmaStatistic
fields.documentation: -- | The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric.

fields.name: _pmaThreshold
fields.documentation: -- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

fields.name: _pmaUnit
fields.documentation: -- | The unit for the alarm's associated metric.

operations.name: PutMetricData
operations.documentation:
-- | Publishes metric data points to Amazon CloudWatch. Amazon Cloudwatch
-- associates the data points with the specified metric. If the specified metric
-- does not exist, Amazon CloudWatch creates the metric. It can take up to
-- fifteen minutes for a new metric to appear in calls to the 'ListMetrics' action.
--
-- The size of a PutMetricData request is limited to 8 KB for HTTP GET
-- requests and 40 KB for HTTP POST requests.
--
-- Although the 'Value' parameter accepts numbers of type 'Double', Amazon
-- CloudWatch truncates values with very large exponents. Values with base-10
-- exponents greater than 126 (1 x 10^126) are truncated. Likewise, values with
-- base-10 exponents less than -130 (1 x 10^-130) are also truncated.  Data that
-- is timestamped 24 hours or more in the past may take in excess of 48 hours to
-- become available from submission time using 'GetMetricStatistics'.

required.name: _pmdNamespace
required.documentation: -- | The namespace for the metric data.

optional.name: _pmdMetricData
optional.documentation: -- | A list of data describing the metric.

fields.name: _pmdMetricData
fields.documentation: -- | A list of data describing the metric.

fields.name: _pmdNamespace
fields.documentation: -- | The namespace for the metric data.

operations.name: SetAlarmState
operations.documentation:
-- | Temporarily sets the state of an alarm. When the updated 'StateValue' differs
-- from the previous value, the action configured for the appropriate state is
-- invoked. This is not a permanent change. The next periodic alarm check (in
-- about a minute) will set the alarm to its actual state.

required.name: _sasAlarmName
required.documentation:
-- | The descriptive name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the
-- user's AWS account. The maximum length is 255 characters.

required.name: _sasStateValue
required.documentation: -- | The value of the state.

required.name: _sasStateReason
required.documentation:
-- | The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state (in human-readable
-- text format)

optional.name: _sasStateReasonData
optional.documentation:
-- | The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state (in
-- machine-readable JSON format)

fields.name: _sasAlarmName
fields.documentation:
-- | The descriptive name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the
-- user's AWS account. The maximum length is 255 characters.

fields.name: _sasStateReason
fields.documentation:
-- | The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state (in human-readable
-- text format)

fields.name: _sasStateReasonData
fields.documentation:
-- | The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state (in
-- machine-readable JSON format)

fields.name: _sasStateValue
fields.documentation: -- | The value of the state.
